attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that EU roaming charges are abolished despite the Brexit vote
attributes.background: The EU has introduce a law to ban roaming charges across the union. However, as UK is leaving those laws won't apply for UK networks and charges will go up. One way is to make a law to stop networks charging for EU roaming. This law could be reciprocal to make negotiations easier.
attributes.additional_details: This law will work by making mobile networks abolish roaming charges or face fines if they fail to do so. This will protect holidaymakers from shock bills. You could also introduce a reciprocal law for EU holidaymakers coming to the UK. This means that EU mobile networks can't charge for roaming in he UK. This will make negotiations easier as it will benefit EU citizens as well.

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Increase digital government funding and introduce online voting
attributes.background:
- Increase funding of GovUK development
- Introduce citizens' and residents' online certificates for online voting and online conclusion of contracts
attributes.additional_details:
Gov.uk website is a robust but limited online application which is created to simplify life for interacting with government. This petition is aiming to state the importance to increase funding of more rapid development of digital services of the government.
Other ideas to discuss:
- Introduce digital citizenship (see Estonia)
- Introduce emails for all citizens where all communication lands
This may help to make UK more competitive.

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Decommission Sellafield safely and responsibly, it is too dangerous.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUE2846zgCA  
This link shows you a report about the dangers of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION.
I call upon - all people in 200 miles of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION, elected members of the government,  and anyone who loves our country, and its people.
attributes.additional_details:
It came to my attention recently that the Sellafield installation is actually in a state of overloading and dangerously falling into disrepair, due to lack of investment and reductions of staff. 
I ask you all to come together to force the authorities to make the necessary decisions to ensure the safety and security of this installation, which threatens the health and lives of many uk residents.

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Restrict the ability to freely purchase sperm on Internet websites and now apps
attributes.background: It is grossly unacceptable to completely disregard a mans ability and purpose to father children. Women have the ability to freely browse Internet websites and now mobile apps for sprem based on specific requirements of donors eg height, IQ, race "without a medical reason". It's morally wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
I don't want to promote the websites and/or apps but it's free to download and sperm can be bought for the price of £950 at the click of a button without a medical reason.
If this catches on it could be a huge problem that would leave men unable to naturally father children and I find this seriously disturbing.

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Make teachers do inset day training in school holidays
attributes.background: School Inset days drastically effect working families and all training should be done during school holidays so as not to effect families daily routines as well as the pupils everyday learning
attributes.additional_details: Teachers set inset days usually just after school restarts from school holidays so why can they not do them during the free 13 weeks they have each year

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Create a virtual parliamentary constituency for serving armed forces personnel.
attributes.background: The choice of voting for the constituency a Serving Member (and his/her family) find themselves in (when based in the UK) or voting for a constituency they had lived in previously is often unsatisfactory.  In my experience serving members don't vote at all and few use their MP.
attributes.additional_details: The creation of a virtual constituency will give serving members of the Armed Forces and their families the opportunity to vote for a person who will directly represent them in Parliament, regardless of where they are based. Critically it will allow the incumbent MP, regardless of party, to immerse him/herself in the specific needs of serving personnel and their families. This role is to be independent of the MoD and the Minister of State for the Armed Forces which reflect Government needs.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Honour  Paralympians & Olympians by declaring an extra bank holiday in 2016
attributes.background: As a comparatively small island together we have come second in the Medals table for the 2016 Olympics, and are currently second in the Paralympics medal table. This is a quite remarkable achievement.
attributes.additional_details: Lets make it happen, and demonstrate that we are proud of their achievements and know how to celebrate.

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to see if UK citizens wish to keep all their current rights.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that a Referendum be held to see if there is public support for the adoption of new legislation, of whatever kind, by Parliament or other executive means, that will result in the loss or modification of any rights currently held by every UK citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the form of the Referendum should be two questions as follows:

YES. I agree to the adoption by Parliament of new legislation that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK Citizen.

NO. I do not agree to the adoption of new legislation by Parliament that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK citizen.

Currently, Parliament seems set on invoking legislation that will result in the loss of rights by all.

attributes.action: Remove the pension lifetime allowance.We want to be self-reliant in retirement.
attributes.background: The current  lifetime allowance means we will not have enough pension income  in retirement. We want to have enough income so we are not reliant on the state and with a decent pension income, we will fuel the economy. This makes even more sense as the population is ageing. Please think again!
attributes.additional_details: As an example, a final salary pension of £18k p.a. eats up 58% of the lifetime allowance before any further pension savings are made. It does not leave much headroom and will not equate to extravagant riches in old age. Please reconsider the lifetime allowance limit.

attributes.action: Greater emphasis of nutrition & health education within the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Good nutrition is essential to optimise growth and development, and for the general well-being of all people. It should be a priority within the N.C in light of increasing rates of obesity, diabetes, cancer and other conditions. A large percentage of the population are uneducated on nutrition.
attributes.additional_details: Health education should be a core principle within the curriculum. Starting from KS1, children should learn the importance of food and how to cook simple receipes. Throughout the stages, students should learn how to cook a variety of healthy dishes, the importance of macro and micro nutrients, physiological and psychological impacts, body measurements, dietetics, metabolism etc. This should come within education. Many families/homes are now uneducated in this and heavily rely on processed foods.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: "Parliamentary privilege" must not be used to keep members above the law
attributes.background: Despite having been jailed for fiddling expenses in 2011, a new CPS case of false accounting against sitting Tory peer Lord Hannigfield recently collapsed when Justice McCreath ruled he couldn’t be prosecuted for falsely claiming attendance allowance – on the grounds of “parliamentary privilege”!
attributes.additional_details:
This taints the reputation of both Houses, makes a mockery of reforms following the "expenses" scandal and sets the dangerous precedent of placing parliamentarians' expenses beyond public scrutiny or prosecution.

Therefore, we call on both Houses to debate and reform the practical application of "parliamentary privilege" in cases of prosecutable false accounting or fraud. Also, along with this, members subsequently convicted in the courts should automatically be deprived of their seats/titles.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: All petrol/diesel pumps must display taxes taken per litre and per gallon.
attributes.background: Most people aren't aware that the vast majority of the cost of fuel doesn't go to the oil companies who have to drill to find the stuff, transport it around the world, refine it, and deliver it to your local garage, but to the state that has done none of this.
attributes.additional_details: The sum of taxes should include VAT and the taxation of the oil companies and the garages or stores who provide the pumps.

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal Lagoon Power instead of Nuclear - they are green & reliable!
attributes.background: Tidal power is totally reliable and always available. It does not rely on ANY fuel, the wind, or the sun. There is NO waste, it is totally green and works 24/7/365. The tide timing is different in different places, so there are no big gaps. If designed properly, they could be virtually invisible.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has a big coastline, and the proposed tidal lagoon in Wales could be the ideal starting point and testing ground, though I personally think the artist's impression is awful and I think the whole thing should be hidden away out of sight, which it could be if designed properly, a bit like the Cruachan hydroelectric generating station in the mountains in Scotland.

attributes.action: Make GPs stop giving out prescriptions for over the counter painkillers
attributes.background: In 2015 the NHS spent 87 million pound on prescriptions for paracetemol alone aswell as 27 million on ibruprofen. These are medication that can be purchased for 20p in any shop imagine the money the NHS could save and how many urgent operations could be made with the money that will be saved.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Free First Aid courses
attributes.background: First Aid courses should be available for free as it is a life skill which all of the public should know. This will encourage the public to be good citizens and respect their society.

attributes.action: Stop self employed people paying tax in advance as paye do not pay in advance
attributes.background: As self employed individual I pay tax in advance and really struggle to do so .I am a self employed electrician ,I have good years and bad years so when the HMRC asked for money in advance , I really struggle to pay it ,this is unfair as when I was a paye they never asked for 6 month tax ahead
attributes.additional_details:
If I should fall short of money ,example people paying me late . Then I have to pay interest on tax money I should be paying in advance to the HMRC. 
I believe this system makes many small individuals and small company's go out of business. 
Let's to be fair to all who work paye and self employed people

attributes.action: Bypass BREXIT but work for EU reform to allow UK border immigration control
attributes.background: Parliament is a representative democracy but should urgently respond to the disquiet over immigration expressed in the referendum. The implications of BREXIT are potentially horrendous for both the UK and EU and it is critical not to terminate, but to reformulate our membership.
attributes.additional_details: The  Referendum, widely recognized to have flawed origins and severely compromised by misinformation, should be considered accordingly. There are now new opportunities first to renegotiate our relationship with the EU regarding border control, and then work to improve structures with democratic processes, openness and transparency at its heart.

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.
